title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 4) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited immigration act 2004 (visas) (amendment) (no 4) order 2021

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 2. This Order comes into operation on 27 November 2021.
text_raw: 2. This Order comes into operation on 27 November 2021.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is
text_raw:
3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is 

amended – 

(a) 

in Schedule 1, by the deletion of “Botswana”, “Lesotho”, “South 
Africa”, and “Swaziland”, and 

(b) 

in Schedule 5, by the insertion of – 

(i) 

“Botswana” after “Albania”, 

(ii) 

“Eswatini” after “Eritrea”, 

(iii) “Lesotho” after “Lebanon”, 

(iv) “Namibia” after “Moldova”, and 

(v) 

“South Africa” after “Somalia”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 November, 2021. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [640] 3

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order further amends Schedules 1 and 5 to the Immigration Act 2004 
(Visas) Order 2014. The Order provides that nationals of Botswana, Eswatini 
(formerly Swaziland), Lesotho, and South Africa are required to be in 
possession of a valid Irish visa when landing in the State. The Order also 
provides that nationals of Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Namibia and South 
Africa are required to be in possession of a valid Irish transit visa when 
arriving at a port in the State for purposes of passing through the port in order 
to travel to another state. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [640]
